subject: Law
title: Why Environmental Law Exists
description: Learn Why Environmental Law Exists in one minute.

hook.text: A river catches fire. Smog kills thousands. Before environmental law, pollution was just the cost of progress.

buildup.text: Environmental law regulates human impact on air, water, land, and ecosystems through statutes and regulations.

discovery.text: The 1960s-70s saw a wave of laws: the Clean Air Act, Clean Water Act, and the creation of the EPA.

twist.text: Before these laws, companies could dump waste into rivers legally. There was no federal pollution standard.

climax.text: The Cuyahoga River fire (1969) and Rachel Carson's 'Silent Spring' turned public outrage into legal action.

punchline.text: Rivers on fire taught us: nature needs legal protection too.

quiz.question: What event helped spark modern environmental law?
